item.title: Activites-Symposium,Feminism
Hamilton
item.description:
CHARACTERS

  • ALEXANDER HAMILTON, the first-ever Secretary of the United States Treasury, is the musical’s protagonist.
  • MOTHER, the mother of Hamilton.
  • GEORGE WASHINGTON, the mentor of Hamilton.
  • BURR, the friend and the narrator of Hamilton.
  • ELIZA, wife of Hamilton.
  • JEFFERSON, a rival of Hamilton with opposing views.
  • ENSEMBLE

ACT ONE: YOUTH

Time:

Scene 1

Introduction, several people recite:

PREVIOUS ANCESTOR: (standing in the middle of the stage) How does a bastard, orphan, son of a whore and a Scotsman, dropped in the middle of a forgotten Spot in the Caribbean by providence, impoverished, in squalor Grow up to be a hero and a scholar? (rise arms, move to the right)

item.title: Catching Butterflies
item.description:
Butterflies. What is the first thing that comes to mind when you hear it? It could be the butterfly fluttering in the meadow. But for me, it is the butterflies flying in my stomach. So now you might understand why this x-ray picture with butterflies is doing here. This, quite literally, is just having butterflies in your stomach. So why is it here?

Let me just begin with telling you what having ‘butterflies in your stomach’ means. This describes the nervous energy in your belly before or during situations where you might feel anxious or excited. I hate this feeling, but you see me standing here, which means I have caught some of them (grabs some of it).

item.title: Beauty of Books
item.description:
I’ve heard a lot of unique topics, so I’m going to start with something common – books. No matter text books we use for class, books we read outside of school for research, novels for relaxing… Books are woven into our lives.

Do you remember the first time you read a book? I couldn’t. But that feeling was something I’d always remember. It felt as if we had an immediate bond, and I couldn’t take my eyes off the intricate and fancy pictures. From the soft, fabricated touch of my first book to the scratchy paper and smooth cover of my recent books, I loved reading. Books have been my companions on adventures through time and space, making it a friend worthy of love and time.

item.title: Line of passion
item.description: Today I’m going to start with something common in our lives—books. I don’t know if you could remember properly the first time when you started reading a book. I couldn’t. But that feeling was something I’d always remember. It felt as if we had an immediate bond, and I couldn’t take my eyes off the intricate and fancy pictures. From the soft, fabricated touch of my first book to the scratchy paper and smooth cover of my recent books, I loved reading. I don’t understand passion or love that clearly, but books have been my companions on adventures through time and space, making it a friend worthy of love and time.
